results.title: Ari Aster Has Something Funny to Show You. Don’t Be Scared.
results.abstract: The maker of “Midsommar” may be known for horror, but he thought that film was comical. With his latest movie, “Beau Is Afraid,” the dark humor is more apparent.

multimedia.caption: Ari Aster initially intended “Beau Is Afraid” to be his first film. Instead he spent time during the pandemic lockdown honing the script into an uncompromising follow-up to “Midsommar.”
multimedia.copyright: Victor Llorente for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Ari Aster initially intended “Beau Is Afraid” to be his first film. Instead he spent time during the pandemic lockdown honing the script into an uncompromising follow-up to “Midsommar.”
multimedia.copyright: Victor Llorente for The New York Times

results.title: Little Lionsgate Soars to the Top With John Wick Ticket Sales
results.abstract: “John Wick: Chapter 4” took in roughly $73.5 million on its opening weekend, a rare phenomenon this far into a series.

multimedia.caption: Keanu Reeves in “John Wick: Chapter 4.”
Keanu Reeves in “John Wick: Chapter 4.”
Keanu Reeves in “John Wick: Chapter 4.”

results.title: ‘John Wick: Chapter 4’ Review: There Will Be Blood, Yeah
results.abstract: In the latest and longest movie set in Wick World, Keanu Reeves’s titular assassin visits Paris and paints the town red.

multimedia.caption: Keanu Reeves, foreground, as the laconic assassin John Wick in the franchise’s fourth installment.

results.title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: From slapstick heist films to a deaf action hero, this month’s picks rely on unsuspecting characters.

results.title: With Films Like ‘Inside,’ One Actor Does the Heavy Lifting
results.abstract: Filmmakers behind movies that place one character in one location discuss the challenges this type of project brings.

multimedia.caption: Willem Dafoe plays an art thief trapped in an apartment in “Inside.”
Willem Dafoe plays an art thief trapped in an apartment in “Inside.”
Willem Dafoe plays an art thief trapped in an apartment in “Inside.”

results.title: ‘A Good Person’ Review: Zach Braff’s New Chapter
results.abstract: The filmmaker behind “Garden State” has created a fully drawn female character in Florence Pugh’s grieving addict. But this recovery drama often has too heavy a hand.

multimedia.caption: Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman in “A Good Person,” a film directed by Zach Braff.
Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman in “A Good Person,” a film directed by Zach Braff.
Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman in “A Good Person,” a film directed by Zach Braff.

results.title: ‘What the Hell Happened to Blood, Sweat & Tears?’ Review: What Goes Up
results.abstract: The rise and fall of a classic-rock band is chronicled (shakily) in this documentary.
des_facet: What the Hell Happened to Blood, Sweat & Tears? (Movie)

results.title: ‘Reggie’ Review: Reggie Jackson on Himself, Racism and, Yes, Baseball
results.abstract: Jackson, a.k.a. Mr. October, was called a lot of things during his storied career with the Yankees. A new documentary goes beyond the nicknames.

multimedia.caption: In 1977, Reggie Jackson hit three home runs in a single World Series game. He was a star on the field, and now he’s a star in the documentary “Reggie.”
In 1977, Reggie Jackson hit three home runs in a single World Series game. He was a star on the field, and now he’s a star in the documentary “Reggie.”

results.title: ‘Tori and Lokita’ Review: Precarious Lives in Exile
results.abstract: In the new movie from the Dardenne brothers, two underage African migrants struggle to make a home in an unkind land.

multimedia.caption: Joely Mbundu as Lokita and Pablo Schils as Tori in the Dardennes’ new movie.
Joely Mbundu as Lokita and Pablo Schils as Tori in the Dardennes’ new movie.

results.title: ‘The Worst Ones’ Review: The Gazes of Children
results.abstract: In their feature, the directors Lisa Akoka and Romane Gueret build a provocative critique of filmmaking practices.

results.title: ‘Petite Solange’ Review: Coming of Age as Your Parents Divorce

results.title: ‘Ithaka’ Review: In Julian Assange They Trust
results.abstract: A frustrating new advocacy documentary about the WikiLeaks founder, with appearances by his father and wife, loses its footing on weak assertions and reporting.

results.title: ‘Nam June Paik: Moon Is the Oldest TV’ Review: Art Onscreen
results.abstract: A new documentary follows the ceaseless innovations of a man who made art out of television sets and found inspiration in disruption.
des_facet: Nam June Paik: Moon Is the Oldest TV (Movie)

multimedia.caption: A new documentary traces the career of Nam June Paik, an influential video artist who forged novel avenues of expression and communication.

results.title: ‘The Five Devils’ Review: The Scent of the Past
results.abstract: Part queer love story, part supernatural psychodrama, the uncanny second feature by Léa Mysius follows a young girl with a magical sense of smell.

results.title: John Wick Sure Has a Lot of Friends for a Lone Assassin
results.abstract: How does a taciturn solo killer have so many pals? The films’ creators can’t really explain, but each character has a raison d’être in this world.

results.abstract: The screenwriter overcame a stroke as he worked to revise the beloved but befuddling Golden Age musical for a Broadway revival.

results.title: ‘Kubrick by Kubrick’ Review: Stanley Plays Himself
results.abstract: A primer on the filmmaker’s career and interests won’t offer much that will surprise even mild obsessives, but it does pierce some of the mystique.

multimedia.caption: In “Kubrick by Kubrick,” the director interweaves excerpts from conversations with Stanley Kubrick with scenes from Kubrick’s movies.
In “Kubrick by Kubrick,” the director interweaves excerpts from conversations with Stanley Kubrick with scenes from Kubrick’s movies.

results.title: Why There Is Talk of a Writers’ Strike in Hollywood
results.abstract: TV and movie writers want more money, but Hollywood companies say the demands ignore economic realities. The deadline to sort out those differences is approaching.
results.byline: By John Koblin and Brooks Barnes
org_facet: Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers

results.title: Adam Sandler Is Awarded the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor
results.abstract: The comedy star was celebrated at the Kennedy Center in Washington for his prolific three-decade career as an actor, writer, producer and stand-up comic.
org_facet: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

multimedia.caption: Adam Sandler became the 24th comic to receive the Mark Twain Prize For American Humor on Sunday night.

results.title: ‘Rye Lane’ Aims to Show You a Real London Love Story
results.abstract: A rare British romantic comedy with Black leads, Raine Allen-Miller’s debut feature celebrates London neighborhoods that are changing fast.

multimedia.caption: In “Rye Lane,” David Jonsson and Vivian Oparah play heartbroken Londoners who spend a day wandering around two lively South London neighborhoods.

results.title: Final Sondheim Musical Will Be Staged in New York This Fall
